item.title: Core data classes
item.description: Product Type Product types represent the top level model, these can be business unit divisions, different offices or locations, development teams, or any other logical way of distinguishing “types” of products.

item.title: Features
item.description: Tags In DefectDojo, tags are a first class citizen and are recognized as the facilitators of organization within each level of the data model.

item.title: Product Health Grading
item.description: Product Health Grading Within DefectDojo’s system settings, you have the opportunity to enable a grading system for your products. For that you have to enable (“Enable Product Grading”).

item.title: Permissions
item.description: System-wide permissions Administrators (aka superusers) have no limitations in the system. They can change all settings, manage users and have read / write access to all data.

item.title: Questionnaires
item.description: Questionnaires Questionnaires provide a means for collecting information from developers and respective stakeholders. DefectDojo includes functionality to create new questionnaires with custom questions, open questionnaires to receive responses for certain time periods from insiders or outsiders, and connect questionnaires with new or existing engagements.

item.title: Example workflows
item.description: Example 1 - Bill the security engineer Bill wants a place to keep track of what he's worked on, so that he can show his boss exactly what issues he reports, and statistics about how long it takes to close them.
